title: Mike Pompeo
added: Immediately after capitol riot and the 2021 Senate electoral count, confirming the upcoming presidency of [[Joe Biden]], Pompeo met with the incoming Secretary of State [[Anthony Blinken]].  The [[State Department]] also directed diplomats to affirm Biden's victory.<ref>{{Cite web|url=https://www.cnn.com/2021/01/07/politics/state-department-social-media-biden/index.html|title=State Department tells diplomats to affirm Biden's victory after the capitol riot}} </ref>

title: Mike Pompeo
added: The administration designated [[Cuba]] a "state sponsor of terror" on Jan. 11th, reversing a signature foreign policy achievement of the Obama administration, a move endorsed by Biden.  Pompeo announced the move,<ref>{{Cite web|url=https://apnews.com/article/joe-biden-mike-pompeo-cuba-venezuela-foreign-policy-41ddf75b0c13d290cd539d90e6227b0a|title=Trump hits Cuba with new terrorism sanctions in waning days}}[[Associated Press]]</ref> citing Cuba’s continued harboring of U.S. fugitives, its refusal to extradite a coterie of Colombian guerrilla commanders as well as its support for Venezuelan leader [[Nicolás Maduro]]

title: Mike Pompeo
added: On January 21, 2021, the 2nd day of Joe Binden's presidency, Pompeo tweeted: "1384 days!", raised the possibility that he is aiming running for the next President.  The election day will be 1384 days in the future.

title: Mike Pompeo
deleted: On January 21, 2021, the 2nd day of Joe Binden's presidency, Pompeo tweeted: "1384 days!", raised the possibility that he is aiming running for the next President.  The election day will be 1384 days in the future.

title: Mike Pompeo
added: During his tenure as Secretary of State, Pompeo was described as among the staunchest Trump loyalists in the cabinet.<ref name=":13" /> During his tenure, he routinely flouted norms and protocols followed by his predecessors.<ref name=":13" /> These included using his office to campaign for Trump's re-election officials, firing and criticizing State Department inspectors general, and standing on the sidelines while Trump and his allies harassed career diplomats.<ref name=":13" /> Under Pompeo's tenure, career State Department officials quit, were forced into retirement or fired, and were replaced by inexperienced political appointees.<ref name=":14" /> Similarly to Trump, Pompeo praised dictators and criticized traditional democratic allies.<ref name=":13" /><ref name=":14" />
